name: BattleSphere
description:
A 3D space combat simulator, BattleSphere's story was based upon an episode in the original Star Trek television series and it plays similarly to Star Raiders.

Seven alien races vie against each other - the victor will control the galaxy. They meet in an arena in Sector 51, a spherical sector of space formerly used by the Earth government to secretly test new weapons and starships. Gameplay consists of 5 different play modes with different scenarios and goals. Choose from various starships (each with unique weapons systems) and battle the aliens, who have also chosen their best fighters and have many space ships of their own.

shot.caption: Title screen.
Main menu - You'll be greeted to a variety of options such as Single Console (single-player), Network Mode (Multiplayer), etc.
Single Player Menu - There's 4 modes to play such as Gauntlet (endless mode), Free-For-All (battle royale), Pilot Training and the main mode; Alone Against The Empire
Interior of the Arrow Fighter by the O'Catanut race. You have two types of radar on the 21 ships of the game: Front (displays ships on your POV) and Aft (displays ships behind you).
Firing at the Ajax, O'Catanut's Supership. BattleSphere is one of the few Jaguar titles to feature true transparency.
By pressing 5 on the Jaguar's keypad, you can toggle between other weapons. Each ship has a different set of weapons.
Destroying the Blade in-sight, the Bomber ship of the Se'bab race.
Blown up by a rival.
One of the weapons in the game makes the exact same firing noise as in Star Raiders, which is one of the biggest inspirations of BattleSphere.
Gauntlet Mode - Think of it as an endless Missile Command 3D but will full 3D control. You need to defend 6 of your starbases from wave after wave of enemies.
When you destroy a Capitol Ship, they explode in a supernova-like animation.
Gauntlet Mode - Fighter wave.
Pilot Training - Here's where you can get familiarized with the game's mechanics. For example, this is level 1, where you need to destroy stationary targets.
Pilot Training - Level 2 - Here, you need to eliminate moving targets.
Pilot Training - Level 3 - This is where you need to get rid of targets who are trying to evade your shots.
Alone Against The Empire - In other words, Star Raiders 2000. You have a map where you can command ships to defend starbases or fight against enemy ships or capitol ships in higher levels.
